Micronovae are now fully accepted (Yes, just recently). We don't necessarily need stars to nova at those vast distances any longer. Nor do they need to be supernovae. Our own star can be a candidate. Recurrently, so--no more need for a binary system to be the conduit for the nova, either. Sufficient dust will do the trick. Various papers (hundreds over the years) will convey the larger picture. But, this shows us that it is now accepted. There is no longer only one type of nova.

source: eso org / public / news / eso2207 /
